item.dc:creator: @Tic_Tac Tic Tac
item.description:
@Tic_Tac wrote:

[quote=“Jessekinss, post:28, topic:276416”][quote author=islphrs link=topic=365042.msg2770374#msg2770374 date=1241080310]

I don’t really want to read it all, but from what I did read, I found these things that I didn’t like;

-It will be a mix of PKing and skilling.
Mixing skilling and PKing isn’t a good idea in my opinion.

RSC mixed pking and skilling.[/quote]

RSC also died.

It didn’t die because they mixed pking and skilling, so what’s your point?

Are you really serious…

Obviously I didn’t have a point, I was just being stupid to respond to his stupid comment.[/quote][quote=“Jessekinss, post:26, topic:276416”][quote author=islphrs link=topic=365042.msg2770329#msg2770329 date=1241072165]

I don’t really want to read it all, but from what I did read, I found these things that I didn’t like;

-It will be a mix of PKing and skilling.
Mixing skilling and PKing isn’t a good idea in my opinion.

RSC mixed pking and skilling.[/quote]

RSC also died.[/quote]You’re a fucking idiot mate, I’ve read every post you’ve made in this topic and it seems to be like you’re just a hater.
Skilling and Pking is what made RSCA, so rethink your statement please.

And OP, 90% of these ideas are worth putting in, but the whole “pay to be unbanned”, doesn’t really seem like an option to me, depending on the experience rate, there’s no point in giving people a second chance, because 90% of the time, they’ll do it again.

item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

Earlier you asked how to make most of the landscape water. Fastest way is taking one sector you’re not gonna use and make it all water. Then make copies of that sector and rename them into the sectors you want to turn into all water.

item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

Hello, i’ve not seen you around here before maybe because my inactiveness but you seem like a clued up guy. Nice idea’s btw, forgive keith aka ancients with the kiddie name, he thinks hes somewhat of a coder not really just likes to act smart ect… as i quote him “most is xml edits” lol he makes me laugh, maybe so it’s xml edits but guess what its different and it will work. I’ve noticed the only person posting in ehre that is clued up about rsc dev. is “Adu” so hes the type of person you want to listen to along with ko9 and peter ect… Well Good Luck with this idea i’d love to help but i havn’t been into rsc dev. since last year when i got a new computer i removed everything and started with more important studies. If you do need any extra helping just give me a shout.

Good day.

item.dc:creator: @Jessekinss Jessekinss
item.description:
@Jessekinss wrote:

[quote=“adu, post:23, topic:276416”][quote author=Jessekinss link=topic=365042.msg2770244#msg2770244 date=1241062508]

-It will be a mix of PKing and skilling.
Mixing skilling and PKing isn’t a good idea in my opinion. The idea of working for (considering the XP rate) 3 weeks wont attract many users, as proven with my/other servers, users don’t want to spend that much time working.

But yet rsca is the most popular server?

I’ve heard on RSCA most people stake - so don’t throw that shit at me.
[/quote]

Not on rsca f2p…there is no dueling.[/quote]

I’ve never logged on RSCA. If there’s no dueling - cool. However a point has been made that the ONLY reason why people train for so long on that server is because it has a lot of other users. If this guy brought his server out with skilling, it wouldn’t work. Take other skilling servers that have went down for example.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Jessekinss Jessekinss
item.description:
@Jessekinss wrote:

[quote=“total annihilation, post:1, topic:276532”]Thanks for the feedback, Jesse, but I have a few things to say.

First of all, no one is going to train for 3 weeks. I already said that on this server, you don’t need to get 99 strength, or some other 99 stat, before PKing. And, even at 10x xp rate, you wouldn’t need more than 2 weeks to get flats. Besides, the XP rate can be raised.

Second, I already said that the XP rate for skilling is going to be MUCH higher than the XP rate for combat stats. Getting 99 mining, smithing, or fishing, is going to be quite easy.

As for my policy on autoing, I can honestly say that I DIDN’T steal it. I don’t recall seeing it anywhere else. Correct me if I’m wrong, and I’ll give credits to whoever thought of it.

For the landscape, I like the idea. I’m not going to make anything extremely fancy. The wilderness will become smaller, and there will be an area, with an Edgeville-like city to the north, fishing dock to the south, training spots in the south-west, and mining/smithing in the south-east.[/quote]

Ok, but I still disagree. All I’m going to say here is, having the XP for skills higher than the combat XP will destroy your economy, as users can reach their goal faster.
Also having low XP wont stop people from getting what level they want to PK at. If people like 123 PKing, they’re gunna get 123 combat regardless.

Read full topic
